title: What should I give to the teachers I'm asking for letters of recommendation from? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am warning you that letters of recommendation are largely a waste of time and few read them or take any notice of them. No student has ever given me one to read. I have written very few (mainly for fellowships). You give them your transcript and things like where you were born, outside interests and things not on the transcript that you think are useful. Go easy on the good citizenship, community works and sport nonsense. Ask to see it when they have written it.

Are you talking about a gift or what kind of information you should give the? If it's the type of information, they need to know where the letter is going, what it's being used for, and what kind of information you want them to put in the letter. If you're talking about a gift, those aren't necessary. I always thought it was an honor to have a student ask me to write them a letter of recommendation.
